text: I noticed today that TPD have acquired BetMover and one of the developers. Any GPS players think this will have any kind of impact on things?

elements.text: I noticed today that TPD have acquired BetMover and one of the developers. Any GPS players think this will have any kind of impact on things?

text:
Much quicker / easier to manipulate etc. whilst building a model. However imo the next step would be to move the model to flumine (or your own trading framework) so that you can better test implementation/ matching etc.

Quite a few follow the pattern of separating model building/generation and trading framework integration.

elements.text:
Much quicker / easier to manipulate etc. whilst building a model. However imo the next step would be to move the model to flumine (or your own trading framework) so that you can better test implementation/ matching etc.

Quite a few follow the pattern of separating model building/generation and trading framework integration.

text: model building stage in my opinion especially on the AI side should be done outside, then validate prices + volumes and matches with flumine.

text: It does look shite to be fair. That said, I have a similar app that looks worse but I don't use it for manual trading just for verification and real time viewing sometimes.

text: @Dave given the average Joe uses Betfair live streaming that can be significantly delayed it could be a help. Problem is with the accuracy though if you ask me. Sometimes the GPS is not accurate at all. Probably need to be using video AND this to try and manually trade

text: I do find it interesting though that they would be needing to pay for a Betfair vendor license as well as lose the revenue from selling the GPS stream so Level Software. I suppose I am just trying to work out what their endgame is based on this move.

text: I suppose it would be interesting to know if this software is displaying precisely the same data that we all get. Or whether they will use some in-house smarts to improve things a bit. I know that is very cynical but I still wonder.

elements.text: I suppose it would be interesting to know if this software is displaying precisely the same data that we all get. Or whether they will use some in-house smarts to improve things a bit. I know that is very cynical but I still wonder.

text: Also, given this is a desktop based app, I assume it won't be using the "raw" UDP feed and that they have some https JSON interface similar to betfairs to forward it on now.

text: When I looked into buying direct from TPD I was told I needed a static IP to connect to their UDP sockets. I assume that Betfair do that and wrap it in their own API to send to Betfair GPS users. This was a while back though so things may have changed. But most home users won't have a static IP address. So I assume that have a similar setup to betfair,

text: Flumine q: Will there be a big performance difference if I instantiate a strategy twice with different params and add them to a flumine instance Vs adding one strategy that takes both sets of params and applies them based on the market? The former seems cleaner but not sure if you lose some performance by having multiple strategy objects

elements.text: Flumine q: Will there be a big performance difference if I instantiate a strategy twice with different params and add them to a flumine instance Vs adding one strategy that takes both sets of params and applies them based on the market? The former seems cleaner but not sure if you lose some performance by having multiple strategy objects

text: There will be but will depend on what the strategy does, assuming it’s simple it will be negligible I would just profile it

elements.text: There will be but will depend on what the strategy does, assuming it’s simple it will be negligible I would just profile it

text: Note that any orders would be sent separately if you do that which will of course impact execution

elements.text: Note that any orders would be sent separately if you do that which will of course impact execution
